intro: Parapyrenaria indo-chinensis, commonly known as the Indochina parapyrenaria, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
